commit.message:
fix breakage on solaris derivates when c ext is not built

the fixed if-condition was inconsistent with a similar one some lines
above. this lead to the following traceback IF the _scandir c ext was
not available:

>>> from scandir import *
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File ".../lib/python3.4/site-packages/scandir.py", line 591, in <module>
    DirEntry = PosixDirEntry
NameError: name 'PosixDirEntry' is not defined
Bump up version number, change to semver

verification.payload:
tree 345308ae9b86a2c79493c7bcdfc5a9a21ea6b6f0
parent 50808360eca0d39eb7c9f553b13798b31efc67bc
author Ben Hoyt <benhoyt@gmail.com> 1533907261 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1533907261 +0200

commit.message:
Remove support for Python 3.3

Rationale: apparently the "wheel" library no longer supports it,
so seems a good time to stop. It's getting old, and we support
3.4 and 3.5, which seems like enough older versions.
